Reviews.Title: “Odada hamambÃ¶ceÄŸi”
Reviews.Author: Marjolein P
Reviews.Content: The location is perfectly near all attractions.Reception personnel speak moderate English. Other personnel, didn't see anyone expect 1 time during breakfast. First time in Turkey I didn't give any tips. Big column in the middle of the room. Last morning I saw a cockroach, creepy. Bathroom not clean, lamp above sink had dust from about over a year thick. After a two minute shower drain will overflow. Second day no hot water. Only showered once. Travel was with Corendon. They tell you what hotel you will be in during busstransfer. Now I know why. I'm learning Turkish, liked Istanbul very much. Hospitality of the Turks is great, but this hotel should be stripped and build up again. KahvaltÄ± (breakfast) was not good. Not much, bread (sliced at 7.00 if you're there after 9.00 its gets very tough. Oherwise cucumber, tomatoes, olives, white cheese. Cups (margarine, cheryjam, honey. Black tea. Mock orange juice (taste like diluted kidsdrink). Cold water tasted like the plastic can it was in. In summary location is perfect. Like Sultanahmet neighbourhood, but the hotel was bad. I itend to visit Istanbul again, but not with Corendon anymore.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for a big city”
Reviews.Author: Anton_Spitsyn
Reviews.Content: If to talk about Sublight hotel, where I have stayed in August 2010, I can say that this hotel is right what's required if you plan to Stay in Istanbul for a business trip or as a toursit. It is situtedin Sultanahmet, the area with all the main symbols of the city - Topkapi palace, Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque and so on, but at the same time it is on a quite street, so the noise of nightlife won't interfere in your sleeping. The room I lived in (Don't know about the other ones) is rather small, and had no balcony, Just bed, TV, writting table with chair and mirror. There has also been a shower with toilet, again small. Although you really do feel at ease in this size of room, and it is not a problem, if you spend most of time in the city. And now about the food. The Hotel is BB, so there is the only breakfast you get. There is no great variety of food, but nevertheless, yu can find what you want and there is always a free table. So, to sum it all up, if you are not planning to stay in the hotel all the day round, Sunlight is a pace for you.

Reviews.Title: “Bad is an understatement!!”
Reviews.Author: SandraBC
Reviews.Content: I went to Sunlight hotel as a family trip. The whole staff was very friendly except for the receptionists. There are only two receptionists men, who don't talk well English and are very rude! They don't help you at all. The hotel wasn't clean and not appropriate for children or a family trip, or any other trip. There are so many better hotels around this, Sunlight definitely was the worst I've seen in whole Istanbul especially because of the small rooms and bad hygiene. I'm never going back to this hotel and can not recommend it to anyone! I travel every single year with my family, this is my worst experience so far.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: The Hotel seemed nice at first, until we entered our hotel room. They hadn't vacuum cleaned underneath the beds for probably more than a year. The luggage carriers were very friendly but the people behind the desk were extremely rude and hardly spoke any English which is a requirement when working in the tourism industry. Contrary to the pictures the roof terrace only offers a view from above and has no caffe or restaurant. The air conditioning also did not work properly. The only good thing about the Hotel is it's location, although it's situated in a somewhat neglected neighborhood it's a 10 min walk from the shore and a 5 min walk to the main shopping street of that district. Overall the Sunlight Hotel is not worth the money and I'm sure there are plenty of other Hotels that offer much better service for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to start a city tour and to return to find rest and energy for the next day”
Reviews.Author: Spinring10
Reviews.Content: Central location in the old town, good to reach by public transport. Cheap and clean room with AC, wireless internet, television. Terrace with view on the Marmanan Sea. Good breakfast. Reception open 24hours. Postservice for i.e. postcards. Shop and restaurants close by the hotel. Stayed for 3 nights, can only recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, average hotel, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: shwetashetty
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was very convenient, walkable distance to the mosques and most of the tourist spots, the rooms were very small but the staff at the hotel was very rude, racist and discourteous. Absolutely impolite and didn't think that their customers should be treated with respect. So other that the convenience part, dont think would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: KellyB629
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location. You can walk to the mosques, no problem. The hotel room was very small, and it was difficult to keep the water in the shower without it getting all over the bathroom. The linens were clean, but the carpet was a bit dated. The lobby was lovely and the breakfast was pretty good. They do offer a safety deposit, which was nice as well. Staff was friendly. Okay hotel for a budget traveler, don't expect much though.

Reviews.Title: “terrible experiment”
Reviews.Author: simon-lc
Reviews.Content: we reserved a double for two from italy,having a document from internet with all details.when we arrived the man claimed that we hadnt indicated we wanted the room for two.he wanted 30 euro extra.although we showed the document he didnt accept and we accepted everything and went up to a room but even the garbage was not taken away in addition to unchanged sheets.we suddenly decided to leave there.we went to a hostel it was much cheaper and cleaner..

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: MikaParis
Reviews.Content: Just average, but OK for the price. good location. our room was nice and had a nice view on the sea. the main problem is the staff : unfriendly with their customers. they are also able to stop the air conditioning in the middle of the night to save money and tell you it is broken. beware the taxis in Istanbul. the taxi-meter is falsified (not always). never pay more than 15 liras if the taxi stays inside Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: sultanine
Reviews.Content: Arrival We flew by Easy Jet and arrived late at night at Sabiha GÃ¶kÃ§en Airport. Even at 3 o'clock in the morning some public transfer (HAVAS) were ready to bring us to Taksim (9.5 YLT pp). From there we took a taxi to the Sunlight hotel in Sultanahmet (about 35 YLT). Hotel Generally the hotel was clean, exept of some damp spots. All the time we had warm water. The heating was okay, though we could not regulate it ourselve. Breakfast contained of white bread, jam, honey, labane, eggs, cheese, legumes as well as hot and cold drinks. Return to the Airport Advise: For a cheap transfer to Sabiha GÃ¶kÃ§en Airport it is advisable, to take the ferry from EminÃ¶nÃ¼ to KadikÃ¶y (1.3 YLT pp) first. Just opposite the harbour you will find the bus station. From there busses leave to the airport frequently (up to about 9 in the evening). The journey takes something more than 1 hour and costs around 3 YLT pp.

Reviews.Title: “Sunlight Hotel & Istanbul.....”
Reviews.Author: pivocigar
Reviews.Content: After arriving at the pleasant Sabiha Gokcen airport we were met and transferred to our hotel by Fez Travel (Â£10 p/p each way) who proved to be hihgly professional and freindly. The transfer took about an hour in a spotlesss mini-bus with ourselves and Sammy the gude as the only passengers. This transfer was booked over the internet at only 24 hours before departure and proved to be a big relief after a 3.5 hour scrum on easyjet. Later, the return to the airport with Fez proved to be just as punctual and hassle free. The Sunlight Hotel is situated in a pleasant side street just a 10 minute stroll from the Blue Mosque, Kapali Carsi (covered bazaar) and the Cemberlitas tram stop. There are many restaurants and a few decent small grocery stores close to the hotel and the area (like all of Istanbul) felt very safe to stroll day or night. The hotel was having an external facelift (literally) at the time of our stay and so the drilling at 8am outside our small window was met by ourselves as a neccesary wake up call! Our room was in a state of general disrepair and as much as we could it was hard to ignore a few stains and damp spots on the walls. The breakfast was very basic (i took down meat to stuff into my rolls) and generally the staff were a bit miserable......having said that we lost our passports, camera and wallet at one point and the guy on reception acted quickly and efficiently to inform the British consulate. Fortunately the passports were found and returned to our hotel after being found on a tour bus which we had never agreed to book, was cancelled after a 2 hour bus ride trying to find a boat up the Bosphrus....and quite spoiled an otherwise fantastic day. We actually had to ask for a refund! Overall, I quite liked the Sunlight Hotel...the room and services were rubbish, the staff unsmiling...but is in a great little location...it has a roof on its head...enjoy and have fun if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: Heike65
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms are very basic but clean, and after comparing prices, I thought is was a very good deal. The TV only got 3 channels (all in Turkish), but since I wasn't there to watch TV I didn't care. The location is within walking to many historic sights in Instanbul (Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Hippodrome, etc.), and also close to the Grand Bazaar if you walk in the other direction. The breakfast is served downstairs and is typical Turkish (boiled eggs, cucumbers, tomatoes, yoghurt, bread, olives). From the roof of the hotel there is a small bar area. It was closed when I was there, but I was still able to go up there to check out the nice views of sunrise over the Bosphorus.
